title: Man Utd predicted line-up to face Chelsea in Carabao Cup

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer takes his Manchester United side to Chelsea tonight hoping to progress to the Carabao Cup quarter-finals.

The Red Devils have shown signs of improvement of late and are on a three-game unbeaten run heading into the clash at Stamford Bridge.

A 1-1 draw with Premier League leaders Liverpool was followed up by a Europa League win at Partizan Belgrade before Sunday’s stroll at Norwich.

Solskjaer is set to be without seven players for the trip to Chelsea due to injury.

Paul Pogba (ankle), Luke Shaw (thigh), Axel Tuanzebe (hip) and Eric Bailly (knee) are among the notable absentees.

(Image: Manchester United via Getty Imag)

Sergio Romero is expected to start between the sticks in place of David De Gea.

Brandon Williams was named man of the match against Partizan Belgrade and should return to the team at left-back, while Ashley Young is likely to occupy the other full-back position.

Harry Maguire can expect a breather, with Victor Lindelof and Marcos Rojo set to form the central-defensive partnership.

Another decision facing Solskjaer is whether to give youngster James Garner a go in midfield following his impressive cameo at Carrow Road.

(Image: REUTERS)

“For just 10, 15 minutes tonight Jimmy played as well,” the United boss said.

“I thought he was excellent, because he’s calmed us down when we wanted to see the game out.”

If Garner is handed a start then he will likely line up next to Scott McTominay or Fred, who has earned praise from Solskjaer for his recent performances.

(Image: Getty Images)

Elsewhere, it will be interesting to see whether Marcus Rashford or Anthony Martial leads the line.

Rashford has featured in all-but one game this season so a well-earned rest could be wise.

The lone striker will need support, which is likely to be provided by Juan Mata, Jesse Lingard and Daniel James.

Man Utd predicted line-up: Romero, Young, Lindelof, Rojo, Williams, Garner, McTominay, Mata, Lingard, James, Martial
description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's men have enjoyed a positive week and will be hoping to continue their unbeaten run by progressing in the Carabao Cup
